reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge has a very comfortable gathering area with wood logs making up the walls. It would be a great facility for a group retreat, away from digital distractions. Although it is located just off the TCH, the lodge is not well situated for overnight journeys. We had to travel to Lewisporte to find supper.
reviews.title: Location not ideal

reviews.text: We stayed here on July 31 and August 3, on our way to St John's and on the way back. It is a lovely log lodge in a gorgeous setting, about a mile off the main road so very quiet. The rooms are done in pine, very nice decor and spotlessly clean. There is no telephone or television in the rooms. We did not arrive at the lodge until 9:30 pm on the second night and the lights were pretty much all out; the outside light came on when we got out the vehicle and Winnifred recognized our voices. We did stay in the common room but only until 10:30 as Gary indicated that was sort of "quiet hour". Breakfast was included and everything is homemade, very tasty and filling, Winnifred is a great cook and hostess. We did not eat dinner here as you have to book 24 hours in advance. We drove into Lewisporte the first night and got there shortly after seven and the two restaurants were closed. We ate at KFC which was quite good. The price at the lodge was reasonable considering the hot breakfast. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My parents stayed here while on a driving trip and loved it. The lodge is all in pine, they had a full breakfast. Winnifred and Gary are very friendly. Payment is by credit card only. Flowers and tress all around the lodge.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, very friendly

reviews.text: The Lodge was really easy to find. You will encounter: absolute Quietness. Lovely, discreet hosts, very helpful, thanks Gary for getting the luggage. Bright, pretty lodge with light colored woods. Huge, open common areas incl great terrace to sit, loungers.View of lake (heard loons call each other); nice gardens too. Bathroom on the small side but clean and layout is good; great shower. Standard rooms are not very spacious, but okay; I loved being able to have the window open all night. The bed was very cozy. No rugs or carpet, all hardwood. Everything very clean. No Internet, or TV, but magazines and games. Must eat here! Bring own wine. Dinner consisted of three courses, fresh, tasty, healthy. Winifred is a very good cook. Breakfast was an tasty omelet filled with fresh vegetables and cheese, buttered homemade toast, jam, orange juice and coffee or tea- plenty to start into the day. I will definitely make this a stop whenever I am in the Area.
reviews.title: Quiet, Peaceful, Relaxing

reviews.text: We hung out overnight waiting out hurricane warnings in the big log and stone central area and in our cozy log rooms. Dinner was fabulous with fresh ingredients from the garden and a tasty cheesecake. Breakfast is included but you must order dinner ahead of time if you want to partake. I didn't bring wine but the gracious hosts supplied me with a couple of glasses of nice savignon blanc to accompany their perfectly done salmon. The place is worth driving out of Gander.
reviews.title: Cozy retreat with great food and hospitality
